properties.areaDesc: West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 1 at 11:07AM MST until January 3 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Denver CO
properties.description:
...A ROUND OF SNOW AND HAZARDOUS WINTER TRAVEL CONDITIONS FOR THE
NORTHERN MOUNTAINS...

.Moderate to heavy snow has developed in the northern mountains
of Colorado and will continue through the early afternoon before
decreasing in intensity. Another increase in snowfall rates will
occur this evening before tapering off overnight. Light snow will
continue through Thursday. Gusty winds of 40 to 55 mph will also
produce blowing and drifting snow and reduced visibilities, in
exposed areas, and over the higher mountain passes. The heaviest
totals can be expected in the mountains north of Rabbit Ears Pass,
with moderate snowfall totals, in the Front Range Mountains and
Summit County.

* WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 8 to 16
inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph.

* WHERE...Rabbit Ears Pass.

* WHEN...Until midnight MST Thursday night.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy
blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The
hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening
commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MST THURSDAY NIGHT
